quote: A beautiful day begins with a beautiful mindset.
Life doesn't get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
You are strong enough to face it all. Even if it doesn't feel like it right now.
Look at everything as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time. Then your time on earth will be filled with glory.
Not all storms come to disrupt your life. Some come to clear your path.
They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: somone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more.
We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
There is only one thing more painful than learning from experience, and that is: not learning from experience.
Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
You cannot judge what should bring others joy, and others cannot judge what should bring you joy.
If you start to think the problem is 'out there' stop yourself. That thought is the problem.
Happiness cannot be travelled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
Live with intention. Walk to the edge. Listen hard. Practice wellness. Play with abandon. Laugh. Choose with no regret. Do what you love. Live as if this is all there is
In our daily lives, we must see that it is not happiness that makes us grateful, but the gratefulness that makes us happy.
The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
One of the most courageous things you can do, is identify yourself, know who you are, what you believe in, and where you want to go.
Everyone has inside of her a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be, how much you can love, what you can accomplish, and what your potential is.
If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. If you look at what you don't have in life, you'll never have enough.
Define success on your own terms, achieve it by your own rules, and build a life you're proud to live.
We need to accept that we won't always make the right decisions, that we'll screw up royally sometimes - understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it's part of success.
Don't let anyone rob you of your imagination, your creativity, or your curiosity. It's your place in the worls; it's your life.
Taking care of yourself makes you stronger, for everyone in your life. including you.
Life is not about waiting for the storms to pass. It's about learning how to dance in the rain.
Take care of your body, it's the only place you have to live.
Live your life by a compass, not a clock.
A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.
The most challenging times bring us the most empowering lessons.

Twenty years from now, you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do, than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
We can battle the sea, or we can embrace it. Sometimes she will be sweet, and sometimes mean as a snake. We must embrace the experience, and trust we will get through it.
No pessimist ever discovered the secret of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new heaven to the human spirit.
When you talk, you are only repeating what you already know. But if you listen, you may learn something new.
The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.
You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.
Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
Strength doesn't come from what you can do, it comes from overcoming the things you once thought you couldn't.

In an age of acceleration, nothing can be more exhilarating than going slow. And in an age of distraction, nothing is so luxurious as paying attention. And in an age of constant movement, nothing is so urgent as sitting still.
